intro: Ecbolium meyenianum, commonly known as the yellow brome, is a flowering plant in the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green inflorescences that consist of spikelets, typical of the grass family. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Ecbolium meyenianum is sometimes cultivated as a forage grass due to its hardiness and adaptability.
